entry.title: Fausta Labia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the Italian soprano Fausta Labia (pictured) worked at the Royal Swedish Opera, she appeared as Mascagni's Iris at La Fenice in Venice and as Wagner's Sieglinde at La Scala in Milan?

entry.title: Watchdog (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Watchdog created a fact-checking app within 36 hours of its founding?

entry.title: Gentner Drummond (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gentner Drummond flew in the first combat mission of Operation Desert Storm?

entry.title: Copland Track (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a hut on New Zealand's Copland Track had to be moved after being hit by a mudslide just 13 weeks after opening?

entry.title: Brent Ladds (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ontario Hockey Association president Brent Ladds once agreed to let a player reduce his suspension by serving as a referee?

entry.title: Buford High School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that South Carolina's Buford High School was named in 1925 after Continental Army Colonel Abraham Buford, who fought at a nearby battlefield in 1780?

entry.title: Hector d'Andigné de Grandfontaine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Treaty of Breda did not establish the borders of Acadia, so Hector d'Andigné de Grandfontaine established them at the Saint George River?

entry.title: Chicecream (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chicecream's ice cream flavours include aged cheese and bird's nests?
